column4: does ubuntu clean out /tmp on shutdown or maybe startup?  i put something there and it was gone when i rebooted?
yes, one or the other (shutdown or startup)... pretty sure all *nixs do
all don't.  mandriva doesn't... at least not by default.  i have stuff in /tmp on my mandriva box that i've had there since the 90's :)
ok, well all my debian, red hat, fedora & solaris boxes do... and I'm pretty sure it happens on this ubuntu laptop too
